text: Parepigynum is a genus of liana in the family Apocynaceae, first described as a genus in 1973. It contains only one known species, Parepigynum funingense, native to Guizhou and Yunnan Provinces in China.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesFlora of China Vol. 16 Page 187 富宁藤 fu ning teng Parepigynum funingense Tsiang & P. T. Li, Acta Phytotax. Sin. 11: 395. 1973. The species is listed as endangered.China Plant Specialist Group 2004. Parepigynum funingense. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 23 August 2007. ==References== Category:Apocyneae Category:Endemic flora of China Category:Monotypic Apocynaceae genera Category:Endangered flora of Asia Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
